00067 typedef vector<double> SampleSummaries;
00068 typedef map<int, SampleSummaries> ContextMap;
00069 typedef map<int, ContextMap> AlleleMap;
00070 
00071 typedef pair<int, int> AlleleContext;
00072 typedef pair<AlleleContext, double> ASummary;
00073 typedef vector<ASummary> AlleleVector;
00074 typedef vector<ASummary>  MaxContextVector;
00075 typedef vector<MaxContextVector> SampleMaxs;
00076 
00077 class LessThan : public binary_function<ASummary, ASummary, bool> {
00078   public:
00079     bool operator()( const ASummary &summary1, const ASummary &summary2)
00080       {return summary1.second > summary2.second;}
00081 };
00082 
00083 
00084 class AlleleLessThan : public binary_function<ASummary, ASummary, bool> {
00085   public:
00086     bool operator()( const ASummary &summary1, const ASummary &summary2)
00087       {return summary1.first.first < summary2.first.first;}
00088 };

00090 class QuantLabelZMulti : public QuantLabelZ {
00091 
00092   public:
00093 
00094     // Constructor:  We pass the information into the base class QuantLabelZ via the initialization list.
00095     QuantLabelZMulti(enum Transformation transform, double K, bool lowPrecision, int praThresh, int ccMaxAlleles, string ccType, string ccVersion) 
00096         : QuantLabelZ (transform, K, lowPrecision) {
00097 
00098         m_coder = new GenoCallCoder(ccMaxAlleles,ccType,ccVersion, '\0');  
00099 
00100         // Setup self doc
00101         setupSelfDoc(*this);
00102         setOptValue("transform", transform);
00103         setOptValue("K",ToStr(K));
00104         setOptValue("lowprecision", lowPrecision);
00105         setOptValue("pra-thresh", ToStr(praThresh));
00106         setOptValue("cc-alleles", ToStr(ccMaxAlleles));
00107         setOptValue("cc-type", ccType);
00108         setOptValue("cc-version", ccVersion);
00109 
00110         m_PraThresh = praThresh;
00111     }  
00112 
00113     virtual ~QuantLabelZMulti() {
00114       delete m_coder;
00115     }

00120     * @brief Supply a little how/what/why about the algorithms this
00121      * class performs and what parameters it takes.

00123      */
00124     static SelfDoc explainSelf();
00125 
00126     void getSequentialPrior(std::string &name, snp_param &tsp);
00127    
00128     /** Fill in our self documentation from current state. */
00129     static void setupSelfDoc(SelfDoc &doc);
00130 
00131 
00132     /*  The functions setUp and computeEstimate are two functions that are required of a QuantMethod.
00133 
00134         In QuantLabelZ setUp performs 3 things: 
00135             1) creates individual probeGroups for the alleles (only 2 alleles) 
00136             2) summarizes the probes  for each allele.
00137             3) creates the contrast/strength values.
00138 
00139         These constrast/strength values are passed to the computeEstimate function which does the genotyping.
00140 
00141         In QuantGTypeMultiMethod 1 and 2 will be performed in setUp and the 3rd will be done in computeEstimate
00142         along with the genotyping.  The reason for this is that we only need to perform contrast/strength computations
00143         on the summary values which correspond to maximum contexts, as these are the only alleles genotyped. These
00144         max contexts cannot be determined until all allele/contexts have been summarized and thus to avoid storing
00145         all contrast/strength values we calculate only those needed after all summarization has been done.
00146 
00147         As well, we will not create member data structures to hold the probeSets for each allele/context since
00148         the actual probeSets are only needed to compute Summary values, and thus they can be created in memory
00149         and destroyed after summarization.  (The actual probeSets in QuantLabelZ ARE stored but I don't think this
00150         is necessary.) 
00151     */ 
00152

00155                std::vector<ChipStream *> &iTrans, PmAdjuster &pmAdjust);

00206    /** 
00207     * How many genotyping calls do we have? Also indicates how many
00208     * samples there are.
00209     *
00210     * @return Number of genotyping calls made.
00211     */
00212     virtual inline size_t getNumCalls() { return m_CallsMulti.size(); }
00213 
00214     virtual string getContext(unsigned int index) {
00215       if(index >= m_Context.size()) {
00216         Err::errAbort("Asking for context at sample index " + ToStr(index) + " when Probeset " + 
00217                       m_ProbesetName + " has only " + ToStr(m_Context.size()) + " samples.");
00218       }
00219       return m_Context[index];
00220     }
